member.summary: This is the main driver class of this application.

member.name: T:ExerciseProblems.Solver
member.summary: This is the class that will do the heavy-lifting of solving all problems.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.FindDifference(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will calculate the absolute difference between the input number, n and 51. If the value of n is greater than 51, return triple the absolute difference.
member.param: The input integer, provided from the console.
member.returns: The absolute difference which is an integer.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.LeftRotateArray(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will return an integer array that is left rotated.
member.param: The array that is blank, and going to be the output of left rotation.
The array that is coming in as input from the user.
The number of rotations to be conducted.
The size of the input array.
member.returns: An integer array that is the result of the left rotations.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.FindNumbersWithEvenNumberDigits(System.Int32[])
member.summary: This method will find the number of elements in the array where the number itself has an even number of digits.
member.returns: A total count of even-numbered integers.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.MakeAcronym(System.String)
member.summary: This method be able to take the input string and create an acronym.
member.returns: A compressed version - or the acronym.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.FindAlternatingSums(System.Int32[])
member.summary: This method will allow for finding the alternating sums.
member.param: The array of integers coming in from the command line.
member.returns: An array of integers of alternating sums.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.MultiplyArrayElements(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will make sure to calculate the product of the elements in both arrays.
member.returns: An integer array that represents the necessary result.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.AvoidObstacles(System.Int32[])
member.summary: This method will be calculating the obstacles to avoid.
member.param: The input array, consisting of the obstacles.
member.returns: The minimum length of the jump in order to avoid all obstacles.

member.summary: This method will solve the knapsack light problem.
member.param: The maximum weight of the knapsack.
member.returns: An integer of the knapsack weight that is to be carried.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.ExtraNumber(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will select the extra number.
member.returns: The extra number that has been selected.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.ReachNextLevel(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will solve the reachNextLevel problem.
member.param: The threshold required to reach the next level.
member.returns: The output result and having the player reach the next level.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.IsInfiniteProcess(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will execute the core algorithm behind the is infinite process problem.
member.returns: A boolean result to see if the two numbers result in an infinite process.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.BogoSort(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will show the implentation of the Bogo Sort.
member.param: A boolean value determining whether or not to display output in the console.
The time delay between each output to the console.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.BoxBlur(System.Int32[][])
member.summary: This method will solve the Box Blur problem.
member.returns: A 2D array representing the blurred image.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.BubbleSort(System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will be executing the bubble sort algorithm.
member.param: The size of the array, or the number of moves to sort the entire array.
member.returns: An integer value which represents the number of moves taken to sort an array.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.TinyPairs(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will be taking two arrays of equal length, and a number k and comparing to see if the constructed number is less than k.
member.param: The number to be comparing with.
member.returns: The number of times that the constructed number is less than k.

member.name: M:ExerciseProblems.Solver.IsDigit(System.Char)
member.summary: This method will check if the incoming symbol is a digit or not.
member.param: The character symbol to check accordingly.
member.returns: A boolean value determining if the symbol or character is a digit or not.
